titleStmt.title: The golden law and emperial principle, or, The universal monarch viz. the soveraignty of salus populi (not voluntas nor voluptas populi) over all powers and potentates whatsoever ... : besides many other usefuls, to rectify and so to satisfie the conscience scruples of all sorts about the high and disputable point of this time, as, who hath right to the government of our three countries ...
titleStmt.author: Hunton, Samuel.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J.M. for William Lee, and are to be sold at his shop ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
